## How to Choose the Best Bluetooth Speakers

If you are an avid music fan, then you will know better than anyone that the
music you play is only as good as the tool you use to play it, meaning that
quite often, we fork over large sums of money to get the best speakers that
money can buy; but are we shopping blindly by going for the biggest, or the
most well-known? Well, never fear, for this article is here for you to be able
to weigh up the pros and cons of your potential new buy, so you know exactly
what you are getting, and whether it’s right for you!

One big deciding factor in the smartphone era is connectivity, as everything
nowadays is designed with the idea of advancing in technology, wireless
capabilities being one of the newest trends seen in modern devices across the
board. This makes the rise of wireless speakers unsurprising, yet exciting
nonetheless and this is what this article aims to focus on, but we will be
paying tribute to the classic wired set-up as well for all the hardcore
traditionalists.

As these wireless devices have evolved, they have gone from somewhat a novelty
item; sometimes lasting only long enough for a few songs, or perhaps having
that horrible “tinny” sound that poor speakers tend to emit; to something
which could easily replace many day-to-day speakers.

With this evolution, however, comes all the mind-bending jargon and specs that
make the picking process more complicated than necessary for someone who
doesn’t deal in speakers. So, this summary will be breaking down the commonly
used jargon in this introduction, as well as giving some key features to keep
in mind for when you start browsing, before going through some of the biggest
competitors out there.

### Bluetooth

This is simply one of the main connection methods for a wireless speaker. This
just means that two devices (or sometimes more) are connected without any
wires, allowing to transfer data from one device to another (to Bluetooth
speakers in our case).

### NFC

If you have an NFC (Near Field Communication) enabled phone, this makes your
job even easier, as you don’t have to turn on Bluetooth, or search for any
devices; you simply put your phone near the speaker and it will allow to
seamlessly start playing a song.

### Wi-Fi

The downside to Bluetooth and NFC over Wi-Fi is the range of connectivity.
While some companies boast large connective ranges, in truth, they often don’t
quite live up to it; add some walls in between your speakers and your device,
and the signal is even less reliable.

This is where Wi-Fi fills the gap. By connecting your device to your home Wi-
Fi and by doing the same with your speakers, you are able to play your audio
crisply and clearly from anywhere you can access your Wi-Fi. Bluetooth still
has its advantages though and works well in apartments or away from the home,
it’s just down to what your needs are.

### Airplay

[Airplay](https://www.apple.com/airplay/) is an Apple products feature, which
allows you to either share your whole screen or just the audio of your device
with any nearby compatible televisions and speakers. It works in a similar way
to Bluetooth, in terms of range and the process of connection, so really it is
down to preference.

### DLNA

Or “[Digital Living Network Alliance](https://www.techradar.com/news/digital-
home/home-networking/dlna-what-it-is-and-what-you-need-to-know-1079015)” is
the commercial sharing platform for household devices. In effect, this is the
same as Apple Airplay but is compatible with Android and other types of
devices. One thing to note is this isn’t just a piece of software to download,
it is either built-in or it’s not.

### Size and weight

This is fairly self-explanatory and is really only worth considering if you
are either looking for your speaker to fit into a certain space, if you want
it to be as discreet as possible, or if you are looking for a portable speaker
device; regardless of your reasons, it’s something to keep in mind.

### Durability

This is probably only more of a concern if you are looking for a portable
speaker; as if it is being carried around, it is more likely to be dropped.
However, this could also be useful to note in general to gauge the predictable
lifespan of your product (even with [PC speakers](/best-computer-speakers/));
if it is well built with good materials, it may be worth the investment.

This could also be particularly appealing to those of you with young children,
clumsy dogs or attention seeking cats; if they knock your expensive speakers
over, are your confident they will survive the fall?

The material it is made of can also have an effect on the sounds produced and
the overall quality of treble and bass. Wood, for example, is strong but has
pore-like seams between the grains, allowing for more vibration, giving a more
‘acoustic’ feel to your music. This, however, isn’t always ideal for music
with a lot of bass, as the extra vibrations can allow for distortion to
certain frequencies in lower-end, wooden speakers.

A strong, sturdy metal case or even a tempered, rigid plastic, will allow for
bass without the distortion, but it can lead to an overly clean and precise
sound, and if you want a rustic vibe to the music you listen to, you won’t get
it.

### Smart

A feature which is becoming more and more prominent in technology these days
is their smart functions. This can simply mean something which makes things
easier to go between devices, with interesting new functions (think NFC) but
it can also mean that it is a device which doubles as one for its standard
use, and two for an additional useful feature.

The best example we can give, which also fits the article, are home speakers
which are also equipped with voice commands and functions, such as Amazon
Alexa. This generally means that you don’t need to press buttons to change
songs, or that you can take a phone call through your speakers, but in the
case of Alexa, Siri and Google Now ready devices, you can set reminders,
search the web, send messages, etc. all by just using your voice.

### Multiroom

Multiroom is a fun feature which is becoming more and more popular as speakers
come out each year. It does what it says on the tin, if you have multiple
speakers of the same brand, you can play the same song simultaneously through
multiple speakers (potentially in multiple rooms).

This is generally done through an app which is developed by the speaker brand,
but occasionally this can be done, simply by having two of the same brand and
same model speakers.

### Battery life

Goes without saying, if you want something truly wireless and portable, you
are going to want something with a decent battery life. One key thing to think
about with this is that when companies say that their speakers last 16 hours
on a single charge, they generally mean at low to medium volume.

If you are using your speakers at full blast, then you can expect to see some,
sometimes vastly, shorter lifespans. In this article, we used the times that
have been stated by users who have tested them at full volume continuously.

### Sound Quality

Any well-seasoned music enthusiast will tell you that music and sound come out
at different frequencies and can perform differently between these differing
pitches. These are generally categorized as Highs, Middles, and Lows. If you
play around with your equalizer on any audio equipment, you can isolate each
of these levels and hear them individually; sound quality, however, is the
general concept of how the device sounds as a complete sound.

Really this is down to personal taste and the level of precise sound quality
you want, if music is part of your job, for example, this may be a big factor,
whereas if you are just looking for some speakers to play some music while you
read in the evening, for example, this may not matter so much.

### Water Resistance

This is a feature which, again, has gained more recognition as a sought-after
trait in recent years. This doesn’t mean physically taking it underwater and
listening to your favorite playlist whilst swimming under the surface, but
instead, that general splashing and poor weather, won’t affect your device.

This is particularly good for pool parties, outdoor events or even if it is
just installed in a building with sprinklers fitted; if they go off, at least
you won’t have to fork out cash to replace everything.

## 14 Best Bluetooth Speakers You Can Buy in 2020

### JBL Charge 4

#### The Best Waterproof Bluetooth speaker

![jbl charge 4](/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/jbl-charge-4.png)  
Simple in use and at the same time multifunctional – these are probably the
first words which come to mind when you see JBL Charge 4. This Bluetooth
speaker would be a nice choice for those who love listening to music outdoors
as it’s not afraid of rain or any other sources of water like pools or lakes.
JBL Charge 4 is waterproof, so you can be sure that music won’t leave you
after the first raindrops on the speaker.

This portable speaker isn’t the most compact one you can find nowadays, but it
has a range of features which compensate this little drawback. And the first
one is its battery life. Thanks to its rechargeable Li-ion battery JBL Charge
4 is able to provide you with 20-hour music marathon. Besides, this wireless
speaker can share its battery life via USB with your cell phone, charging it
when necessary.

JBL Charge 4 delivers not only music but also phone calls from smartphones,
tablets or laptops. It can be connected wirelessly from a distance. The only
condition is to have a Bluetooth-enabled device.

There is also a built-in microphone which enables hands-free calls which have
clear sound due to the noise and echo-cancelling speakerphone. Consequently,
music delivered by JBL Charge 4 is also crisp and really loud.

Pros:

  * waterproof
  * 20-hour battery life
  * charges other devices
  * links up with other JBL Bluetooth speakers

Cons:

  * some distorts at high volumes

### Bose SoundLink Revolve+

#### Impressive Sound and Portability

![bose soundlink revolve+](/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/bose-soundlink-
revolve.png)  
Bose doesn’t fool around when it comes to sound quality! But they also know
how to create a portable speaker that is both durable and good-looking. Not to
mention, the sound is crystal clear, loud, and rich, and there won’t be any
interruptions due to the 30ft range.

Due to its shape, the SoundLink Revolve+ can deliver a 360° sound experience
which makes it the perfect party companion. The aluminum body makes it
lightweight and water-resistant with IPX4 rating, and the controls are easy to
reach (placed at the top).

You can also use the Bose speaker in the car, at home, or at work, like a
phone speaker or to give instructions to Siri or Google Assistant. The
Revolve+ can go up to 16 hours of constant use and it can be connected to
another Revolve speaker for more power.

Pros:

  * Lightweight & durable body
  * 360° sound experience
  * Great sound richness and power
  * Can be paired with other speakers
  * Can be used as a speakerphone
  * You can control it using the Bose Connect app

Cons:

  * A bit on the expensive side
  * It doesn’t sync if you use the AUX input
  * The app is basic
  * It looks like a lantern

### UE Boom 3

#### Best Bluetooth speaker with 360-degree sound

![ue boom 3](/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/ue-boom-3.png)  
UE Boom 3 is a hefty wireless speaker which has a number of features to
impress you with. Firstly, this speaker has a rechargeable lithium-ion battery
which is able to deliver music non-stop for 15 hours. Still, it can vary
depending on the selected settings and conditions. You can even buy POWER UP
charging dock to charge UE Boom 3 wirelessly.

Secondly, like JBL Charge 4 this Bluetooth speaker is also waterproof. It can
be put into the water up to 1m for about half an hour. Moreover, UE Boom 3 is
dirt-proof as well as shockproof.

If you need to connect your MP3 player to the speaker then just make a use of
3.5mm audio output.
